definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
pinyin: feng1 yan1 si4 qi3 , zhan4 huo3 fen1 fei1

sentences.english: The abilities of a soldier are never known until they have been blooded.
sentences.chinese: 只有經歷過戰火，才知道一個士兵是否是將才。

sentences.english: All the best allies to Yaka must be proven in the furnace of affliction.
sentences.chinese: 凡是雅卡的盟友都必須在戰火的熔爐裏接受試煉。

sentences.english: This hasn't stopped Microsoft or Apple from trying to stoke the fires of the platform wars.
sentences.chinese: 但是這卻沒能阻止微軟和蘋果點燃平臺之戰的戰火。

sentences.english: Will not make any people see wars in the world.
sentences.chinese: 不讓人們看見戰火紛飛的世界。

sentences.english: Even the lowest whisper can be heard ---- over arm voice … when it's telling the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最低聲的耳語也能超越戰火，只要它傳遞的是真相。

sentences.english: Vladimir Radmanovic was born into civil war in the former Yugoslavia.
sentences.chinese: 拉馬出生在南斯拉夫戰火紛飛的年代。

sentences.english: They may use "shits" (guns) and "urine" (bombs) to destroy the environment and sentient beings.
sentences.chinese: 這回的戰火將會使得生態環境及衆生受到嚴重的傷害。

sentences.english: After Japan enkindled flames of war on January 28th in Shanghai, this inclination was shown more distinctively.
sentences.chinese: 一二八戰火點燃後，這種傾向更鮮明地表露出來。

sentences.english: There are jungles and military clashes. She is the only Chinese woman there.
sentences.chinese: 那塊土地戰火紛飛，她是唯一的中國女性。

sentences.english: Since World War II, the Middle East region has been plagued by incessant wars and conflicts. Numerous lives have been lost and many innocent people displaced.
sentences.chinese: 二戰以來，中東戰火不斷，生靈塗炭，百姓流離失所。

sentences.english: Vast stretches of Coruscant's surface were laid to waste in the battle.
sentences.chinese: 科洛桑的表面在戰火中被大片大片地夷爲平地。

sentences.english: The battle for supremacy in the mobile industry has only just begun.
sentences.chinese: 移動產業，誰主沉浮，戰火纔剛剛燃起。

sentences.english: Wars have been waged. Innocents have been slaughtered.
sentences.chinese: 爲此曾經戰火連天，無辜民衆慘遭屠殺。

sentences.english: Nor do they ever panic under fire.
sentences.chinese: 他們在戰火中也絕不會驚慌。

sentences.english: And did you exchange a walk on part in the war
sentences.chinese: 你寧願偏安一隅，而不願在戰火中馳騁嗎？

sentences.english: The United Nation Security Council has been holding an emergency session to discuss there sumption of violence in South Sudan.
sentences.chinese: 就南蘇丹重燃戰火，聯合國安理會進行緊急磋商會議。

definition: storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
